website_summaries.verdict: An in-between color enhancer that delivers natural-looking color. Also conditions hair, and leaves with a high-shine finish.
pros: Works by improving your natural or color-treated hair by adding versatile, temporary color
Great for touching up hair in between hair color
Easy to use, and makes hair look glossy
Produces results in as few as 3 minutes, and can be used daily
cons: Color doesn't last as long as some other products we considered, yet it can stain bathroom fixtures
Scent is strong and not very appealing

customer_reviews.title: Covers the gray wonderfully!
customer_reviews.text: I have had a glaze done professionally at a salon before, and the John Freida Brilliant Brunette works just as well as the salon glaze, at a much better price! I have found for me, the glaze works better if I apply it to dry hair, and leave it on 30-45 minutes or so, then rinse. If I used it in the shower as directed, I just didn't get the results I wanted, which is to cover the gray. I have dark brown hair, and the glaze will give the gray a beautiful auburn color, and leave my hair very shiny and healthy looking. Be sure to wear gloves when applying because it will stain your hands.
customer_reviews.author: Beachgirl

customer_reviews.title: It did make my hair a tiny bit darker. ...

I hope this product remains on the market because it is one beauty product that literally ha no equal.
customer_reviews.author: N.M.B. Clark

customer_reviews.title: I love this so much I am now subscribing this
customer_reviews.text: So, my hair in naturally a auburn/straw berry blonde shade. And honestly it does look good on me so I usually always dye my hair a natural light brown or ash brown to help control the natural brassiness of my hair. However, no matter if it is professionally colored or boxed, within a week or two my red brass tones come out in full force. I was reading about this and decided to give it a go and OMG I love how it adds a nice dimension to my dyed brown hair and ALSO my roots are not red!!! Hallelujah!! Best product I love it so much, easy to use, great color, great price. Thank you John Freida!
customer_reviews.author: Stephie0020

customer_reviews.title: Easy Application
customer_reviews.text: I use this about once a week and I really do love the results. It's easy to apply in the shower, washes out quickly, but leaves strong results. My hair is not only more radiant, but a deeper brown and it keeps me from having to dye my hair as much as I used to. Also, you aren't left with tangles afterwards like some coloring products.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for toning down greys!!
customer_reviews.text: WOW! This is my favorite product i've found for toning down grey hairs. I have dark brown hair, and while this does not completely cover it like a dye would, it definitely helps darken and make them blend more easily into my hair. I actually only use it on my areas where i'd like some coverage. I section my hair, apply it directly to the roots using a foundation brush, and then comb it through a little bit. I let it sit for about 20-30 minutes and then wash my hair as normal. For me, this process is working great! I do this every few washes, but I’m sure more often wouldn’t hurt.
customer_reviews.author: sbrb

customer_reviews.title: It's a great fix to keep my hair looking full
customer_reviews.text: My curly gray hair is thinning with age and between coloring trips to the salon to maintain a light brownish carmel color with warm highlights, , I MUST have a touch up to avoid bald looking spots on the top and temples. This stuff works. It does cover my highlights some, but as it washes, the highlights return. I apply it for 20 minutes on dry hair with emphasis on the roots and I just rinse and condition afterwards. It's a great fix to keep my hair looking full, brown and shiny between professional colorings. It's so better a look than thin, balding and gray at the roots.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Wellman

customer_reviews.title: Works great to tone salon-created highlights
customer_reviews.text: I bought this glaze to tone down my too-noticable blond highlights and it worked perfectly. My hair is a medium brown and I got blond highlights that were a little more substantial than I wanted. Rather than going to the salon for a toner that lasts a couple weeks, I use this a couple times a week. The results are subtle, but just what I needed. My hair feels softer, too. I'm allergic to perfumes/scents and while this does have a (pleasant) smell, it doesn't give me a headache. You definitely need to wash your hands after applying bc it will stain! I'll be buying more after my first bottle runs out.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa_L

customer_reviews.title: Saves me lots of money, looks good

For a person with medium brown hair, who wants to be able to go swimming (which will take the color off), this home remedy is an economical alternative. I do wish they hadn't done away with the two shades of the glaze because the darker one was the one I preferred. But as long as they keep producing this glaze, I will be using it.

I have only white towels and there was no color transfer onto my towels. Easy, very easy.

customer_reviews.title: Great Color Deposit
customer_reviews.text: Use gloves as dye transfers to hands. Took the brassiness out of my hair. Made my roots and greys blend better with my fading hair color. Leaves hair shiny and vibrant. I use it 2x a week
customer_reviews.author: Gabriella Felix

customer_reviews.title: No more roots!
customer_reviews.text: Decided to not to use peroxide based products on my hair anymore so this seemed like a possible option. I am very happy with the results. It feels like a conditioner. Can use as often as I want. No more roots!
customer_reviews.author: TealBlue

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: I have medium to light brown hair and I am starting to get stray grays. I tried to use semi permanent hair color to cover the gray without changing my natural color but it lightened the top layers of my hair and made it a reddish tone. I wanted something that would help to darken the lightened hair so it could blend while growing out. This glaze worked well for that but it also blends away the gray! Lagniappe! This is what I will use from now on as it also makes my hair feel silky and my husband says my hair smells nice:)
customer_reviews.author: MonnaM

customer_reviews.title: My package arrived a mess with a leaky bottle.
customer_reviews.text: I was really bummed when my package arrived. The bottle leaked all over the box, the bottle and the instructions. It is a total mess and completely unusable. So much for Amazon convenience.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda N

customer_reviews.title: It's okay for the price
customer_reviews.text: If you prefer a a reddish brown this is for you. I needed something richer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: subtle gray coverage
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. It covers my grays in such a way that they look like highlights. I still have my natural hair color and it looks like I have a professional highlight job. Also, it makes my hair so silky.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Z

customer_reviews.title: Covers my grays
customer_reviews.text: Worked fairly well covering my gray hair. Need to do frequently.
customer_reviews.author: sara Sicona

customer_reviews.title: Great to use if you are allergic to ingredients in hair dyes
customer_reviews.text: I am about 30% gray and I like this product. It smells nice and blends my silver hairs so that they look like highlights within my dark brown hair. Washes out easily and makes fine hair easy to manage. Will stain.
customer_reviews.author: JonesTheCat

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't cover gray.
customer_reviews.text: Tried for a while, but it won't cover my gray it looks red in the light and noticeably a different color.
customer_reviews.author: S. W.

customer_reviews.title: I use this 2-3 times per week, and it ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this 2-3 times per week, and it covers my grey roots (about 25% grey) and makes my faded ends look less faded. It helps me extend the time between my hair color appointments. It doesn't make my hair shinier, but that's probably because my hair is wavy/curly.
customer_reviews.author: LEP

customer_reviews.title: Best kept Secret
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use. In the past I had my hair glazed professionally, but Thanks to the pandemic, I started doing it myself. So inexpensive and a quality product. I’m a fan.
customer_reviews.author: Janiejones2016

customer_reviews.title: This helps to make my hair shiny and browner. ...
customer_reviews.text: This helps to make my hair shiny and browner. It does dry my hair out a little bit, it also is a product that you need to move quickly with if it gets on your skin.
customer_reviews.author: AS

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I dab 1 - 2 teaspoons along my temples after I towel dry my hair then brush it in thoroughly. I don't rinse it out. No mess. The color is varied, so the brown colors are shiny and the grays are platinum-ish and light. This product is for people who prefer subtle healthy looking hair. It's also less fuss, time and money than a dye-job. No skunk stripes ever.
customer_reviews.author: Lito Lindo

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Love this stuff. Between hair coloring apt. I leave it in a little longer to help hide the grey.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would not purchase again
customer_reviews.text: It was definitely moisturizing, but did not notice a difference. Color was still brassy after using a few times.
customer_reviews.author: Jazmin Rey

customer_reviews.title: Lightly covers gray
customer_reviews.text: This works good as a glaze but I wash my hair daily so this could get expensive. It lightly covers gray. I may use it only for special occasions.
customer_reviews.author: lsh

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: It worked so well, gently covers grays. I would not say they are completely gone but definitely more of them picked up gold tones instead of gray. Quick and easy.
customer_reviews.author: Ariz N. Sirkhan

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Its been 3mos since I have been back to get my hair foiled, tried this, was amazed, everyone asked if I colored my hair. Will continue using it.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Ehh
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your money. It just makes your hair shiny until you wash it again, does not deposit any color
customer_reviews.author: meredith

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work but smells good
customer_reviews.text: No difference after use. But didnt stain my hands much and smells nice — see attached before and after (impossible to tell difference)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Shiny hair!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a product to extend my color and make my hair shine and this does just that!
customer_reviews.author: NatashaD

customer_reviews.title: Product smells terrible!!!
customer_reviews.text: Product smells terrible!! Product is runny and makes a mess. Product has no moisturizing benefits. Returned. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Clair J

customer_reviews.title: No shine
customer_reviews.text: Not what I expected. It didn't add any shine to my hair, but it sort of blended away some of my grays.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Love love love
customer_reviews.text: Love love love!!! I used it once, put it on dry hair then waited for it to fully dry before I washed it out. It blended my grays making it look more like highlights. Doesn’t cover all the grays but smoothes them out. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Talavera

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product that even covers the gray.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product that even covers the gray. Do wear disposable gloves as the color stains the hands.
customer_reviews.author: Pi

product_meta.title: John Frieda Brilliant Brunette Luminous Glaze, 6.5 Ounce Colour Enhancing Glaze, Designed to Fill Damaged Areas for Smooth, Glossy Brown Color (15100)
product_meta.description: John Frieda Brilliant Brunette Luminous Colour Glaze only takes one 3-minute application and can be applied right in your shower. The easy-to-apply treatment uses Shine Enhancers to create a highly reflective surface, as well as pore menders to fill in damaged areas along each strand of hair, helping to create a smooth, more even texture. A hint of glossy, brown colour is added to all shades of natural, colour-treated, and highlighted brunette - and continued use only intensifies the hue. The result is rich, luminous, glossy hair. Ingredients: WATER, PROPYLENE CARBONATE, ALCOHOL DENAT., CITRIC ACID, CYCLOPENTASILOXANE, XANTHAN GUM, FRAGRANCE, DIMETHICONOL, IRON OXIDES/CI 77491, IRON OXIDES/CI 77499, SODIUM HYDROXIDE, MICA, ORANGE 4, EXT. VIOLET 2, YELLOW 10, TITANIUM DIOXIDE, MALIC ACID, PEARL POWDER, METHYLCHLOROISOTHIAZOLINONE, PROPYLENE GLYCOL, METHYLISOTHIAZOLINONE, THEOBROMA CACAO (COCOA) EXTRACT
feature_bullets: Enhanced, rich color: our brilliant brunette hair shine treatment improves natural brown color, and adds gloss for a reflective sheen on colored hair
Helps to mend damaged hair surfaces: with shine enhancers and pore menders, our brilliant brunette glaze fills in damaged areas to create a smooth, mirror like surface
Safe for color treated hair: john Frieda brilliant brunette hair products have been developed for safe use on natural, color treated, or highlighted hair
Formulated for daily or weekly use: after shampooing and conditioning, smooth our luminous color glaze from hair roots to tips, and rinse thoroughly
Salon quality: combine with john Frieda brilliant brunette moisturizing shampoo and conditioner for a finished look; discontinue use prior to a hair color appointment for best results
